sn35.101:4.2: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.
sn35.101:4.4: The eye isn’t yours: give it up.
sn35.101:4.6: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.
sn35.101:4.16: the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact isn’t yours: give it up.
sn35.101:4.18: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.
sn35.101:6.1: mind isn’t yours: give it up.
sn35.101:6.3: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.
sn35.101:6.13: the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact isn’t yours: give it up.
sn35.101:6.15: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.
sn35.101:7.1: Suppose a person was to carry off the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves in this Jeta’s Grove, or burn them, or do what they want with them. Would you think:
sn35.101:7.2: ‘This person is carrying us off, burning us, or doing what they want with us?’”
sn35.101:10.1: Because that’s neither self nor belonging to self.”
sn35.101:11.1: “In the same way, the eye isn’t yours: give it up.
sn35.101:11.3: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness. …
sn35.101:11.7: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact isn’t yours: give it up.
sn35.101:11.9: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.”
